TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed Duplexing extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies whether a printer uses one-sided printing or some type of two-sided (duplex) printing.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the values of this type primarily for these purposes:
- As members of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities.DuplexingCapability%2A> collection, which is a property of <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities>, these values indicate the kinds of one-sided and two-sided printing that the printer supports.
- As the value of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket.Duplexing%2A> property of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket>, they direct the printer to use one-sided printing or some kind of two-sided printing.
The **Unknown** value is never used in properties of <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities> objects.
You should never set a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> property to **Unknown**. If some other <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> producing application has created a *PrintTicket document* that sets the duplexing feature to an unrecognized duplexing option (that is, an option that is not defined in the [Print Schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=186397)), then a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> object in your application that is constructed with that document will have **Unknown** as the value of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket.Duplexing%2A> property.
Although the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> and <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities> classes cannot be inherited, you can extend the [Print Schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=186397) to recognize print device features that are not accounted for in the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities> classes. For more information see [NOTINBUILD: How to: Extend the Print Schema and Create New Print System Classes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/a3600218-1ea5-478a-9853-6560464f2885).
## Examples The following example shows how to test a printer's capabilities and configure the print job to take advantage of them. .
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#PrinterCapabilities](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#printercapabilities)] [!code-cpp[XpsCreate#PrinterCapabilities](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/xpscreate/XpsCreate.cpp#printercapabilities)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#PrinterCapabilities](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpscreate/xpscreate.vb#printercapabilities)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Duplexing OneSided = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Output prints on only one side of each sheet.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Duplexing TwoSidedLongEdge = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Output prints on both sides of each sheet, which flips along the edge parallel to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintDocumentImageableArea.MediaSizeHeight%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Duplexing TwoSidedShortEdge = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Output prints on both sides of each sheet, which flips along the edge parallel to <xref:System.Printing.PrintDocumentImageableArea.MediaSizeWidth%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Duplexing Unknown = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The feature (whose options are represented by this enumeration) is set to an option not defined in the [Print Schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=186397).
